title: Light and Shadow: Deep Learning Through Collaborative Problem-Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational optical concepts and scientific inquiry skills linked to everyday experiences
context.additional_context: Customized experimental activities and discussion-centered classroom environments for adult learners

learning_goals: Learners can explain the principles of light propagation, reflection, refraction, and shadow formation during collaborative problem-solving processes
Learners can creatively present the relationship between physical phenomena of light and artistic applications by analyzing real-life cases
After watching the explanatory video, learners can develop a step-by-step strategy to solve complex optical problems based on acquired knowledge.

resources: Low-Cost Experiment Kits (Flashlight, Cardboard, Mirror, etc.)
Simplified Video Production Materials via Smartphone
Posters and Whiteboards for Visual Aids
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
